questions.question: What is a primary key in a database?
options: A key that uniquely identifies each record in a table
A key that is used for foreign key relationships
A key that allows null values
A key that is used for sorting records
questions.answer: A key that uniquely identifies each record in a table

questions.question: What is the purpose of an index in a database?
options: To sort records in a table
To improve the speed of data retrieval
questions.answer: To improve the speed of data retrieval

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to retrieve data from a database?
questions.answer: SELECT

questions.question: What is the role of the WHERE clause in a SQL query?
options: To specify the columns to be retrieved
To filter the rows based on a condition
questions.answer: To filter the rows based on a condition

questions.question: In a relational database, what is normalization?
options: Combining tables into one for simplicity
questions.answer: Organizing data to reduce redundancy

questions.question: What is the purpose of the GROUP BY clause in SQL?
options: To filter rows based on a condition
To group rows with the same values into summary rows
questions.answer: To group rows with the same values into summary rows

questions.question: What is a foreign key in a relational database?
options: A key that uniquely identifies each record in a table
A key that is used for sorting records
A key that links to the primary key in another table
A key that allows null values
questions.answer: A key that links to the primary key in another table

questions.question: What is the purpose of the JOIN operation in SQL?
options: To filter rows based on a condition
To combine rows from two or more tables
questions.answer: To combine rows from two or more tables

questions.question: What does ACID stand for in the context of database transactions?
questions.answer: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability

questions.question: Which SQL statement is used to add data to a database?
questions.answer: INSERT

questions.question: What is the purpose of the ORDER BY clause in SQL?
options: To filter rows based on a condition
To group rows with the same values into summary rows
questions.answer: To order the result set

questions.question: In a relational database, what is a view?
options: A virtual table based on the result of a SELECT query
A physical table that stores data
questions.answer: A virtual table based on the result of a SELECT query

questions.question: What is the purpose of the COMMIT statement in database transactions?
options: To undo changes made in the transaction
To permanently save changes made in the transaction
To roll back the transaction to a previous state
To delete records from the database
questions.answer: To permanently save changes made in the transaction

questions.question: What is the role of the HAVING clause in SQL?
options: To filter rows based on a condition
To group rows with the same values into summary rows
To filter grouped results based on a condition
questions.answer: To filter grouped results based on a condition

questions.question: What is the purpose of the DISTINCT keyword in a SELECT statement?
options: To filter rows based on a condition
To return only unique values in a column
questions.answer: To return only unique values in a column

questions.question: What is the default sorting order in SQL's ORDER BY clause?
questions.answer: Ascending (ASC)

questions.question: In database design, what is normalization?
options: Combining tables into one for simplicity
questions.answer: Organizing data to reduce redundancy

questions.question: Which type of join returns all rows when there is a match in one of the tables?
questions.answer: OUTER JOIN

questions.question: What is the purpose of the CASCADE option in a foreign key constraint?
options: To update the values in the referencing table when the referenced values change
To delete the values in the referencing table when the referenced values change
To add a new foreign key to the table
questions.answer: To update the values in the referencing table when the referenced values change

questions.question: Which SQL clause is used to filter the results of a GROUP BY clause based on a condition?
questions.answer: HAVING
